author: Special Correspondent
text:
A three-day festival of classical, folk and tribal art forms, Salangai Natham, got under way at the Community Centre open air theatre in BHEL Kailasapuram Township here on Monday.

The event is hosted by BHEL, Tiruchi, under its corporate social responsibility initiative in association with South Zone Cultural Centre, Thanjavur.

Ghoomer of Haryana, Bihu and Galpur of Assam, Gaddi Nati of Himachal Pradesh, Kuchhipudi and Garagala of Andhra, Mathuri/Dhimsa of Telangana, Pooja Kunitha Bhavik Nritya of Karnataka, Sambalpuri of Odissa, Kom Dance of Manipur, Mohiniyattam and Thiruvathirakali of Kerala, Gudmbaja Madhya Pradesh, Mayur Holi of Uttar Pradesh, Purulia of West Bengal, Gair dance of Rajasthan and Karagam, Thappattam, Paraiyaattam and Periyamelam of Tamil Nadu are some of the art forms to be performed at the fest.

A total of 20 troupes from various states with over 300 artistes will be performing at the festival, according to a BHEL press release.
title: Festival of classical and tribal art forms begins
